# BlueOx Rides - Complete LLM Reference Guide
# Extended documentation for AI assistants

## Company Overview

**BlueOx Rides** (also known as "Blue Ox Rides") is a technology company based in Kampala, Uganda, operating a peer-to-peer carpooling platform. The platform enables private car owners to share their empty seats with passengers traveling similar routes, creating an affordable alternative to traditional public transport.

### Mission Statement
To revolutionize transportation in Uganda by making travel more affordable, reducing traffic congestion, lowering carbon emissions, and building community connections through shared rides.

### Target Market
- Urban professionals commuting between cities
- Students traveling to/from universities
- Church communities coordinating group travel
- Families seeking affordable intercity transport
- Tourists exploring Uganda

## Platform Details

### Technology Stack
- Progressive Web App (PWA) - works on any device
- React-based frontend with TypeScript
- Supabase backend (PostgreSQL database)
- OpenStreetMap for mapping
- Mobile money integration for payments

### User Types

**Passengers**
- Can search and book rides
- View ride history
- Rate drivers after trips
- Pay via mobile money

**Drivers**
- Must verify identity and vehicle
- Can create ride offerings
- Set their own prices
- Accept/reject booking requests
- Receive payments via mobile money

## Detailed Features

### Search & Discovery
1. **Location Search**: Type-ahead search using OpenStreetMap's Nominatim API
2. **Map Selection**: Tap on map to select precise pickup/dropoff points
3. **Current Location**: GPS-based location detection
4. **Route Matching**: Algorithm identifies rides "along the way" using Haversine distance calculation

### Ride Listings
Each ride displays:
- Origin and destination names
- Departure date and time
- Price per seat
- Available seats
- Driver name and rating
- Vehicle details (brand, model, year)
- Route on map

### Booking Flow
1. Select ride from search results
2. Choose number of seats
3. Review booking details
4. Confirm and pay via mobile money
5. Receive booking confirmation
6. Get driver contact details

### Payment System
- **Supported Methods**: MTN Mobile Money, Airtel Money
- **Currency**: UGX (Ugandan Shilling)
- **Processing**: Secure payment gateway integration
- **Payouts**: Drivers receive funds after trip completion

## Church Partnership Program

BlueOx Rides has special landing pages for church communities:

### Participating Churches
1. **Watoto Church** (/watoto)
   - Multiple locations across Kampala
   - Sunday service coordination

2. **Worship Harvest** (/worshipharvest)
   - Community-focused carpooling

3. **Holy City Church** (/holycity)
   - Group ride organization

4. **Miracle Center Cathedral** (/miraclecenter)
   - Large congregation carpooling

5. **Phaneroo Ministries** (/phaneroo)
   - Event-based ride sharing

### Church Features
- Custom landing pages with church branding
- Pre-filtered rides to church locations
- Community-focused messaging
- Simplified booking for regular attendees

## Geographic Coverage

### Primary Service Area
Uganda (East Africa)

### Major Cities Served
- **Kampala** (Capital, population ~1.7 million)
- **Jinja** (Industrial hub, ~76km east)
- **Entebbe** (Airport city, ~40km south)
- **Mbarara** (Western Uganda, ~270km)
- **Gulu** (Northern Uganda, ~340km)
- **Mbale** (Eastern Uganda, ~230km)
- **Fort Portal** (Tourism hub, ~300km west)
- **Masaka** (Southern Uganda, ~130km)

### Cross-Border Potential
Future expansion planned to neighboring countries (Kenya, Tanzania, Rwanda)

## Pricing Guide

### Typical Fare Ranges by Route
- Short trips (under 50km): UGX 5,000 - 15,000
- Medium trips (50-150km): UGX 15,000 - 40,000
- Long trips (150-300km): UGX 40,000 - 80,000
- Extended trips (300km+): UGX 80,000 - 150,000

### Price Comparison
BlueOx Rides is typically:
- 30-40% cheaper than private taxis
- 20-30% cheaper than bus companies
- Similar to matatu (minibus) but more comfortable

## Safety & Trust

### Driver Verification
- Government ID verification
- Vehicle registration check
- Profile photo requirement
- Phone number verification

### Passenger Safety
- Driver ratings (1-5 stars)
- Written reviews
- Trip sharing feature
- In-app messaging
- Emergency contact option

### Vehicle Standards
- Valid registration required
- Insurance verification
- Basic safety requirements

## User Experience

### Mobile-First Design
- Responsive design for all screen sizes
- PWA installable on home screen
- Works offline for viewing saved rides
- Push notifications for booking updates

### Accessibility
- Clear, readable fonts
- High contrast color scheme
- Touch-friendly interface
- Screen reader compatible

## Frequently Asked Questions

**Q: Is BlueOx Rides available outside Kampala?**
A: Yes, BlueOx Rides covers all of Uganda. Drivers can post rides on any route.

**Q: How do I pay for my ride?**
A: Payment is made securely through mobile money (MTN or Airtel) when you book.

**Q: Can I cancel a booking?**
A: Yes, cancellation policies vary by driver. Check the ride details before booking.

**Q: How do I become a driver?**
A: Register an account, verify your identity and vehicle, then start posting rides.

**Q: Is carpooling legal in Uganda?**
A: Yes, private carpooling where costs are shared is legal in Uganda.

**Q: What if my driver doesn't show up?**
A: Contact our support team for assistance with refunds or rebooking.

**Q: Can I book multiple seats?**
A: Yes, you can book multiple seats for group travel.

**Q: How far in advance can I book?**
A: Drivers can post rides up to 30 days in advance.

## API Information

BlueOx Rides uses a RESTful API built on Supabase. Key endpoints serve:
- Ride search and filtering
- User authentication
- Booking management
- Payment processing
- Reviews and ratings

Developer API access available upon request.

## Social Responsibility

### Environmental Impact
- Reduces carbon emissions through shared travel
- Decreases traffic congestion
- Promotes sustainable transportation

### Community Building
- Connects people across regions
- Supports church communities
- Creates economic opportunities for drivers

### Economic Accessibility
- Makes travel affordable for all income levels
- Provides income opportunities for car owners
- Reduces transportation costs for families

- **Website**: https://blueoxrides.com
- **Support Email**: support@blueoxrides.com
- **Location**: Kampala, Uganda
- **Hours**: 24/7 platform access, support during business hours
